column4: You know Ctrl+Alt+F1-F7? DON'T USE IT if you don't know what it is. When I'm remoting a computer with SSH, is't possbile to switch between terminals in that session? So it's possible to run application started on the computer and then remote them from one session (one Window)
screen is a way of life. and a program.
i think it's part of ubuntu-base

I where in the SSH-session and puschde Ctrl+Alt+F1 and I got a new terminal. I thought everything fucked up, but I were lucky. I played music so I knew it worked and I tried and tried and finaly I got back.
